content: Continuous gloss to Quincunque vult written in the Leofric Psalter
summary: The Leofric Psalter. On fol. 107 is the Quicumque vult, which has a continuous Old English gloss beginning 'sÆ¿a hÆ¿a sÆ¿a wile hal Æ¿esan toforan eallum | Ã¾earf ys Ã¾Ã¦t healde Ã¾one fulfremedan geleafan' (Holthausen 1942-43).

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Jottings, in various late hands, include 'deus deus meus', 'O maria maris stella', and below that 'O maria maris stella'; Latin verse, a note on feria vi, saints' names, etc.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Calendar (12c) with late obits added in margins.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Aureus hac arte nonus formatur aperte....Linea sola tenet nemo sic esse refutet'

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): In festo Reliquiaruum Exoniensis ecclesie ad processionem

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): '[S]alue festa dies toto uenerabilis euo | Qua datur in sanctis gloria digna deo'

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Explicit liber psalmorum habens uersus vˉcli | Hic psalmus proprię script[um] a dauid et extra numerum | cum pugnaui cum golia. Hic in ebreis codicibus non habetur. | Sed nec a lxx. interpretibus editus est et idcirco repundiandus.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Ego dixi in dimidio dierum meorum'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Cantemus domino gloriosę enim honorifi | magnificatus'

notes.head: Note
notes.body: honorifi on erasure by another hand and underlined to signal deletion, magnifi- added; thus honorificatus › magnificatus.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Canticum moysi in deutro | nomio ad filios israhel

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Canticum Sanctę marię matris domini

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Incipit oratio dominica Secundum matheum.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Pater noster qui es in cęlis sanctficetur no | men tuum'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Credo in deum patrem omnipotentem | creatorem cęli & terrę'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 107r) sƿa hwa sƿa ƿile hal ƿesantoforan eallum | þearf ys þæt healde þone fulfremedan geleafab

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 107v) god is of spede fæder ær ƿorulde akenned | man ys of edwiste moder on ƿorld

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Incipit fides | catholica athanasii alexandriei episcopi

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Quicumqueuult saluus esse ante omnia | opus est ut teneat catholicam fidem'[gloss:] 'swa hwa swa wile hal wesan toforan eallum | þearf ys þæt healde þone fulfremedan geleafan'

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The OE gloss stops after v. 31 (end of fol. 107v). The explicit occurs on the same line as the incipit to the next item.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Liberator animarvm | mundi redemptor iesu christe deus'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Deus cui proprium est parcere saluare & non perdere'

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): pro fratribus | et sororibuset familia | ribus

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Omnipotens sempiternę deus. qui es | misericordia inestimabilis'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Deus qui caritatis dona per gratiam'

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Oratio | contra hostes christiani nomi | nis.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Deus qui diligentibus te misericordiam tuam'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Pie et exaudibilis domine deus noster'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Domine deus pater omnipotens. qui consubstantia | lem'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Domine iesu christe fili dei uiui'

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Oratio ad personam et spiritus sancti.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Domine sancte spiritus. deus omnipotens qui coequalis et co | ęternus'

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Oratio ad sanctam et indiuiduam trinitatem.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Domine deus omnipotens eternę et ineffabilis sine fine'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Per gloriam et uirtutem sanctę crucis'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Singularis meriti solo sine exemplo mater | uirgo sancta maria'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Precor uos sancti angeli et archangeli'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Sancti martyres gloriosi qui fortes | extitistis'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Sanctę uirgines gloriosę quibus data est'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Rogo uos omnes sancti patriarchę et prophetę'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'omine deus omnipotens per intercessiones omnium | sanctorum tuorum'

notes.head: Note
notes.body: followed by neumed incipits to antiphons, etc., all in a smaller hand (ll. 15-18)

notes.head: Note
notes.body: followed by incipits to hymns with neumed responses (ll. 21-22)

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Reuelatur enim ira dei de cęlo super omnem'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Quia cum cognouiss& deum. non sicut deum glorifica | uerunt'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Qui commutauerunt ueritatem dei in mendacium'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Et sicut non probauerunt deum habere in notitia'

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Lectio secundum euangelium sancti iohannis.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: In the same hand as that of response; neumed.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Benedictus deus & pater omnipotens nos famulos tuę'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Scimus quoniam iudicium dei est secundum ueritatem in eos'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Gloria & honor & pax omni operanti bonum'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Matutina supplicum uota quesumus domine propitius'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Si autem tu iudeus cognominaris & requiescis in lege'

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Ends imperfectly, followed by a loss of the central bifolium in the gathering.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Begins imperfectly, after a loss of two leaves after fol. 120. Followed by a neumed response (ll. 1-16)

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Quod deus incommutablis summus & ęternus | existat'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Ac pro hoc quia in deo mutabilitas'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'Nam de incommutabili deo scriptum est'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Dum ad hanc mutabilitatem toto affectu'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): | 'In hoc namque quod de diuinę nature potentia | audiuimus'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): 'Manus tue domine fecerunt me & plasmauerunt me'

objectDesc.extent:
288 mm x 192 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
234 mm x 128 mm (dimensions of all - size of written).
objectDesc.collation: 8 (fols i, 1-7); 8 (fols 8-15); 38 (fols 16-23); 48 (fols 24-30; 26 and 28 are singletons, stubs of these leaves are visible. Fol. 27* after fol. 27. Fol. 30 has repair by stitching); 58 (fols 31-38); 68 (fols 39-46); 78 (fols 47-53; the third leaf of the fol. is missing, and a stub is visible between fols 48 and 48. Fol. 51 is a half-sheet); 88 (fols 54-61); 98 (fols 62-69); 108 (fols 70-77); 118 (fols 78-85; fols 80 and 83 are two singletons); 128 (fols 86-93; fols 88 and 91 are two singletons); 138 (fols 94-101; fols 96 and 99 are two singletons); 148 (fols 102-09); 158 (fols 110-17); 168 (fols 118-23; the fourth and the fifth leaves are missing after fol. 120).
objectDesc.layoutDescription: Ruled for 25 lines, single column, double bounding lines. Prickings in the outer margins. The coloured initial capital letters are place in the left double bounding lines, which is about 1 cm wide. See diagram.
objectDesc.condition: As Pulsiano notes, 'leaves show signs of wear and are generally darkened throughout, with the gutters noticeably darkened. The last leaf is dirty and worn, suggesting that the book was without a cover for a while' (1996, p. 37). Some leaves are repaired by stitching; there are also some modern repairs.
objectDesc.note: Leaves are arranged HFHF. Part of the text (8 lines) is erased at fol. 38v.

handDesc.summary: One hand in Old English in a script contemporary with the script of the psalter, canticles and litany (Ker 1957, p. 307).

hands.name: Glosses
hands.summary: Exeter type script, in very thin pen.

characters.note: e is high in the combination Ã¦.
The descender of long s extends below the writing line and tapers to the left.
y is dotted, and both limbs slightly curves over to the left at the top.
h is insular with distinct serifs at both feet.
g is insular with its loop either open or closed.
Ã° has a tall ascender, with a serif to the left at the top, and a cross-bar has an upwards serif at the right end.
ascenders are tall and split at the end.
descenders often finish tapered and bending to the left.

decoration: Fols 1r-6v Red, green, blue and brown ink is used for the calendar.

Initials and some rubrics of the psalter are alternately green, red, metallic red and blue. Some initials are very elaborate: for example, the display line to Psalm 1 is written in red and black ink; at the beginning of Psalm 51 is an incomplete drawing in lead of an oval containing a floral design.
The text is divided by drawings of figures.
additions:
fol. 20r A small face in red ink.
fol. 54r A drawing in red of a figure with a crowned human head and a serpentine body.

history.provenance: According to Lapidge, the manuscript is 'very possibly one of the two such psalters given to the Exeter chapter by Bishop Leofric in 1072' (1991, p. 74).
history.acquisition: Originally owned by Edward Stillingfleet (1635-99). His collection was bought by Robert Harley in 1707 (Wright 1972, pp. xxxiv, 316), then by the British Museum in 1753.

admin: Described by Takako Kato with the assistance of Hollie Morgan and Sanne van der Schee (2012).
